intro: Clibadium villosum, commonly known as the hairy sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wet or moist soils, often near waterways or in marshy areas. Its leaves are hairy and broad, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Clibadium villosum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of wetland environments.
